medical_history.chief_complaint: Respiratory distress and hemiparesis after surviving a tsunami.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was well until seven weeks earlier when she was swept up by a tsunami. She aspirated water and mud but did not lose consciousness. After the tsunami, she experienced a cough, and two weeks later, pneumonia was diagnosed. Weakness on the right side developed approximately four weeks before admission, accompanied by speech difficulties.
medical_history.family_history: The mother and a cousin died in the tsunami; the father and two adult siblings are alive and well.
